TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and currently lives in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . At the time she lodged the application , she was serving her term of imprisonment .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE she was arrested by the police on suspicion of fraud . At the police station , she was searched and interrogated . She was allegedly forced to make false accusations against herself , as dictated by the police officers . Furthermore , she was asked to sign a document regarding her arrest . She refused to sign the document as , being a NORP speaker , she was unable to read and understand the text of the document properly . CARDINAL of the police officers signed the document on her behalf .

On DATE the local court issued an order for her detention on remand . Throughout the period of detention , the applicant was not provided with a lawyer of her choice and received communications solely in NORP , a language of which she allegedly understands PERCENT . She was also refused the assistance of an interpreter .
On DATE ORG sentenced the applicant to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . She was convicted of fraud under ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .

The applicant appealed against this decision to ORG . She claimed that ORG decision failed to reflect the factual elements of the case ; nor did it take into account the mitigating circumstances . Claiming that the decision was unfair , she asked ORG to reconsider the judgment .

On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision as regards the finding of a guilt , but reduced the applicant ’s term of imprisonment to DATE . The applicant did not agree with this outcome and lodged a cassation appeal before ORG . Claiming total innocence , she asked for acquittal .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request and upheld ORG decision . It held that ORG conclusions were in accordance with the law and that the decision was fair and justified . ORG found no legal grounds for changing the Appeal Court ’s decision .
The applicant lodged an additional appeal asking reconsideration of her case by ORG Plenary . She insisted that she had not committed any crime and that she should be acquitted .

On DATE the Chairman of ORG rejected the applicant ’s request and refused to bring the case to the Plenary ’s consideration . The Chairman stated that all decisions of the appeal and cassation courts were based on and taken in accordance with the law . There was no legal ground either to quash or confirm and , furthermore , no point in bringing the case before the Plenary .
